name: Introduction to Ethics
description: This course is an introduction to the field of ethics. It will cover the basic philosophical concepts, theories, and arguments related to ethical decision-making and moral dilemmas.

name: History of Philosophy
description: This course is an exploration of the history of philosophy from ancient to modern times. It will cover the major philosophical theories, topics, and figures throughout the history of the field.

name: Logic and Argumentation
description: This course is a study of the principles of logic and argumentation. It will cover the principles of reasoning, logical fallacies, and the validity of arguments.

name: Philosophy of Law
description: This course is an exploration of the philosophical issues surrounding the concept of law. It will cover legal reasoning, principles of justice, and the relationship between law and morality.
